property.name: eventFieldName
property.description-key: Enter the Event Name Field schema name which will be used to display on the scheduler. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventFieldStart
property.description-key: Enter the Event Start Field schema name which will be used to display on the scheduler. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventFieldEnd
property.description-key: Enter the Event End Field schema name which will be used to display on the scheduler. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventColor
property.description-key: Enter the Event Color Field schema name which will be used to display on the scheduler. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventId
property.description-key: For Model Apps this is not required but if you are using Canvas you will need to put in the Id field for the Events if you wish to use them.

property.name: resourceField
property.description-key: For a Model App put in the Lookup field of the Resource, for a Canvas app put in the field name that holds the Id of the resource.

property.name: resourceParentField
property.description-key: For a Model App put in the Lookup field of the Resources Parent Resource if you want to utilize nested resources, for a Canvas app put in the field name that holds the Id of the parent resource.

property.name: resourceName
property.description-key: For a Model App this is not required but for Canvas apps if you are using resources enter the field name containing the Resources name.

property.name: resourceGetAllInModel
property.description-key: For Model apps only. If you select true and are using resources then this will ensure that all resources get returned, even those without events in the dataset

property.name: schedulerAvailableViews
property.description-key: Allows you to chose which scheduler view button show up for the user. This is a comma delimited list of the view names which are day,week,month,quarter,year,work_week,event.

property.name: schedulerView
property.description-key: Choose the default scheduler view that will be shown. Options are day,week,month,quarter,year,work_week,agenda,event.

property.name: schedulerDate
property.description-key: Allows you to change the scheduler date from a Date Field in Canvas Apps

property.name: schedulerWorkWeekStart
property.description-key: Enter a number from 0 to 6 to select the first day of the work week. The meaning of 0 depends on the users locale: for example, if Sunday is the first day of the week, 0=Sunday; if Monday is the first day, 0=Monday.

property.name: schedulerWorkWeekEnd
property.description-key: Enter a number from 0 to 6 to select the last day of the work week. The meaning of 0 depends on the users locale: for example, if Sunday is the first day of the week, 0=Sunday; if Monday is the first day, 0=Monday.

property.name: schedulerDisplayWeekend
property.description-key: Controls whether the scheduler displays weekends in non-agenda views. Default is true.

property.name: dayStartFrom
property.description-key: Start hour rendered from in Day view (resource and task views). Enter a value from 0 to 23. Default is 0.

property.name: dayStopTo
property.description-key: End hour rendered to in Day view (resource and task views). Enter a value from 0 to 23. Default is 23.

property.name: minuteStep
property.description-key: Minute step for Day view in non-agenda view. Enter a value such as 10, 12, 15, 20, 30, 60, etc. Default is 30.

property.name: schedulerLanguage
property.description-key: Sets the language/culture of the scheduler. In Canvas apps set this to the Language() function. In Model apps you can leave this blank and it will utilize the language set for the current users. Currently support lanuages are en, fr, de, es.

property.name: showSchedulerHeader
property.description-key: Show or hide the built-in scheduler header. This can be useful if you want to control the scheduler with your own controls in a canvas app.

property.name: resourceNameHeader
property.description-key: Text to display as the Resource Name column header. Leave blank to use the default.

property.name: nonWorkingTimeHeadColor
property.description-key: Color of weekend (non working time) head cells. For example, #999999 or red.

property.name: nonWorkingTimeHeadBgColor
property.description-key: Background color of weekend (non working time) head cells. For example, #fff0f6.

property.name: nonWorkingTimeBodyBgColor
property.description-key: Background color of weekend (non working time) body cells. For example, #fff0f6.

property.name: selectedRecordId
property.description-key: When a record is selected this will be updated.

property.name: selectedSlotStart
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the start date.

property.name: selectedSlotEnd
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the end date.

property.name: selectedSlotResourceId
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the resource id if one is available

property.name: currentRangeStart
property.description-key: When the current scheduler range changes the new Start will be returned.

property.name: currentRangeEnd
property.description-key: When the current scheduler range changes the new End will be returned.

property.name: currentSchedulerDate
property.description-key: Provides the current date the scheduler is set to.

property.name: currentSchedulerView
property.description-key: Provides the current view the scheduler is set to.

property.name: onChangeAction
property.description-key: This will provide which action was taken for an OnChange Event

property.name: actionRecordSelected
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that a record was selected on the calendar.

property.name: isCanvas
property.description-key: Is canvas
